name: 8-chloro-naphthalene-1-carboxylic acid
Reason: Basic unit, naphthalene has a melting point of 80.5 °C. Chloro substituent: +40 °C (more polar and can form stronger intermolecular forces due to higher electronegativity). Carboxylic acid group: +50 °C (ability to form strong hydrogen bonds and dimerization increases melting point significantly).
